title: Gianluigi Lentini: The rise and fall of the world's most expensive player
description: A spectacular untamed talent, Gianluigi Lentini became the most expensive player in the world in 1992. But lust, luck and a determination to live life to his own rules derailed his top-level career.

title: Airport scraps 100ml liquid rule with new scanners
description: Passengers at London City Airport can take two litres of liquids and electronics in their hand luggage.

title: World Snooker Championship: Stan Moody, 16, wins in first round of qualifying
description: Stan Moody, 16, earns the first of four wins needed to reach the World Championship with victory in the first round of qualifying.

title: Donald Trump hunkers down in New York ahead of arraignment
description: New York's mayor issued a warning to what he termed "rabble rousers" to control their "misplaced anger".

title: Masters 2023: Open champion Cam Smith says 'important' for LIV golfers to play well at Augusta
description: LIV Golf players need to play well at the Masters this week to to stamp out the notion "they don't play real golf", says Open champion Cam Smith.

title: Wet wipes ban planned in England to tackle water pollution
description: The environment minister says she will ban wet wipes but critics say it barely tackles the problem.

title: Everton 1-1 Tottenham: Michael Keane stunner cancels out Harry Kane penalty
description: Michael Keane scores a stunning long-range strike to salvage a Premier League draw for Everton against Tottenham in a game that saw both sides finish with 10 men.

title: Nigel Lawson: Reforming chancellor dies aged 91
description: Best known for his role as chancellor during the 1980s, Lord Lawson held key posts under Margaret Thatcher.

title: Obituary: Nigel Lawson
description: He was one of Britain's longest-serving chancellors who presided over the 1980s economic boom.

title: IPL 2023: England's Moeen Ali takes 4-26 as Chennai Super Kings beat Lucknow Super Giants
description: Chennai Super Kings bounce back from their opening-game IPL defeat to beat Lucknow Super Giants by 12 runs.

title: Ros Atkins on… Why were there queues at Dover?
description: The BBC's analysis editor looks at whether post-Brexit checks are to blame for Port of Dover disruption.

title: University strikes mandate renewed for six more months
description: The University and College Union will consult members on new proposals, pending further action.

title: Scots woman dies in Turkey during gastric band op
description: Shannon Bowe, 28, from Denny, near Falkirk, died on Saturday while undergoing weight loss surgery.

title: Thomas Cashman: Olivia Pratt-Korbel's killer jailed for life
description: Olivia's mother pays tribute to her "sassy, chatty" daughter as Thomas Cashman is jailed for murder.

title: Trump arraignment: Private plane, agents, protests expected on journey
description: A three-hour flight from Florida to New York precedes the former US president's appearance in court.

title: The Beatles: How a schoolboy made the band's earliest known UK concert recording
description: A 15-year-old made the band's first known UK concert recording in his school theatre in 1963.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio testifies in trial of Fugees' Pras Michel
description: Hollywood star Leonardo DiCaprio takes the stand as a witness in the trial of rapper Pras Michel.

title: Post Brexit checks contributed to Dover delay, says No10
description: The PM's spokesman says the government was "in discussion" to speed up new passport checks in France.

title: Norwich ex-pub landlord electrocuted on holiday in India
description: Ivan Brown's family say they are "distraught and devastated" at his unexpected death.

title: Timothy Schofield found guilty of sexually abusing boy
description: Timothy Schofield, 54, is found guilty of 11 charges of sexual activity with a child.

title: Match of the Day Top 10: Gary Lineker relives Barcelona hat-trick against Real Madrid
description: Gary Lineker explains why the referee refused to give away the El Clasico match ball as he relives his hat-trick against Real Madrid.

title: CBI widens investigation into sexual misconduct
description: The Confederation of British Industry is facing fresh allegations over individuals' behaviour.

title: Chelsea staff have had 'difficult 24 hours' after Graham Potter sacking, says Bruno Saltor
description: Chelsea interim boss Bruno Saltor says it has been a "difficult 24 hours for all of us" after Graham Potter's sacking.

title: John Lewis wins court battle over Edgar the dragon's Christmas advert
description: A children's author argued that the retailer copied one of her designs in its 2019 Christmas advert.

title: WWE and UFC to merge in new £17.3bn sports entertainment brand
description: WWE and the owners of mixed martial arts franchise UFC are to form a new £17.3bn sports entertainment brand.

title: Sir Alex Ferguson to get Aberdeen European medal 40 years on
description: Sir Alex Ferguson and assistant Archie Knox are to receive medals for Aberdeen's 1983 European Cup Winners' Cup triumph.

title: Bear meat vending machine is a first for Japan
description: Different cuts of locally killed black bear are proving popular with those who see it as a delicacy.

title: Marlene Schiappa: French minister criticised over Playboy photoshoot
description: Marlene Schiappa's photoshoot sparks outrage, as France reels from pension protests.

title: Jurgen Klopp says he is still Liverpool manager 'because of the past, not this season'
description: Jurgen Klopp says he is still Liverpool manager "because of the past" rather than his team's current form.

title: Finland to join Nato military alliance on Tuesday
description: The move was prompted by Russia's invasion of Ukraine and comes after Turkey lifted its veto.

title: Darya Trepova: What we know about accused in Russian blogger Vladlen Tatarsky's killing
description: Darya Trepova seems to be an opponent of the invasion, but friends say she was not radical.

title: Word's deepest fish: Expedition chief explains how video was filmed
description: Scientist Alan Jamieson explains how his team captured footage 8,336m (27,349ft) under water.

title: Olivier Awards: Sir Derek Jacobi warns of 'elitist' theatre ticket prices
description: The star, who picked up an Olivier honour on Sunday, says he's "shocked" by some West End tickets.

title: Man Utd's Leah Galton has no plans to end England absence
description: Manchester United forward Leah Galton says she remains content without international football despite her club form sparking England's interest.

title: New England kit for Women's World Cup has blue shorts because of period concerns
description: England will wear blue shorts instead of white at this summer's Women's World Cup because of period concerns.

title: Lightning storm illuminates skies above Illinois
description: The phenomenon was seen just days series of tornadoes ripped through several US states, including Illinois.

title: Donald Trump to fly to New York ahead of court hearing
description: The former president will be escorted by members of the US Secret Service throughout the journey.

title: Malaysia ends mandatory death penalty for serious crimes
description: More than 1,300 prisoners on death row can now seek to have their sentence reviewed.

title: Kosovo ex-president Hashim Thaci pleads not guilty to war crimes
description: The trial of ex-guerrilla commander turned politician Hashim Thaci opens in The Hague.

title: KSI apologises for racist slur in Sidemen YouTube video
description: The YouTuber says "there’s no excuse" for the language and is taking a social media break.

title: More strikes planned as teachers reject pay offer
description: Members of the National Education Union in England will strike on Thursday 27 April and Tuesday 2 May.

title: Cineworld drops sale of UK and US businesses after failing to find buyer
description: The struggling cinema chain has not yet been able to sell parts of the firm but has secured funding.

title: The talent spotter who signed Madonna and Talking Heads
description: Seymour Stein was regarded as one of the most legendary talent spotters in the music business.

title: Formula 1: Australian GP chief to investigate post-race fan invasion
description: The head of the Australian Grand Prix will investigate after fans got on to the track before the end of Sunday's race.

title: Women's Six Nations: Holly Aitchison shines for England as Wales and France build challenges

title: Rishi Sunak to set out grooming gangs taskforce plan
description: Specialist officers will be sent to help local forces with their investigations into grooming gangs.

title: Ex-Australia opener Slater charged with police assault
description: Police say they were called to a property in Queensland after reports of a domestic violence incident.

title: Bakhmut: Wagner raises Russian flag but Ukraine fights on
description: The stunt was dismissed by Ukraine, which said its army still holds the embattled eastern city.

title: Grand Slam-chasing McIlroy to copy Woods' Augusta masterplan
description: Rory McIlroy says picking the brain of five-time winner Tiger Woods has impressed upon him the importance of the correct Masters game plan.

title: Olivier Awards: Seven things we learned at the ceremony

title: LA Open: England's Georgia Hall runner-up as China's Ruoning Yin wins title

description: Ferry operators say traffic is flowing again following days of disruption blamed on slow processing.

title: Cost of living: The Peterborough mosque-run food hub at Ramadan
description: In a matter of months, a food hub in Peterborough has seen the number needing help grow seven-fold.

title: From Beyoncé to Harry Styles: Why stars are choosing stadiums over arenas
description: Beyoncé, Harry Styles and Arctic Monkeys are all embarking on summer stadium tours in the UK.

title: The other Chinese apps taking the US and UK by storm
description: Four out of the top 10 most-downloaded free mobile apps in the US and UK are Chinese-owned.

title: Why was my neighbour's body not found for two years?

title: Manchester Arena survivors to take 'disaster troll' to court

title: Afghanistan: Rounded up from the streets into Taliban drug rehab

title: The Papers: Sunak on 'woke politics' and a big win for Comer
description: Monday's papers focus on the PM's plans to tackle grooming gangs - and Jodie Comer's Olivier Award.
